p: Plant description: Centella asiatica ( C. asiatica), a small, annual herb belonging to the family Apiceae is found throughout India and commonly known as mandukparni or jalbrahmi. It has small fan-shaped green leaves with white or light purple-to-pink or white flowers and it bears small oval fruit [ 50]. The leaves of mandukparni have been used as a memory enhancer in the Ayurvedic system of medicine [ 51]. Its use has also been described in the African system of medicine, and traditional Chinese medicine. It is used to delay ageing, prevent memory related disorders and is given with milk to enhance memory [ 40].
